The flag register is bit significant, and is defined as follows:
To unerase files - Poke &A701 with &E5,  CAT the disc, and try to load
To disable ESC - Poke &BDEE with  &C9.   To restore ESC, poke the same
To change the value of these  registers, the register number should be

name: C_OPEN
description: data[0] = mode, data[1] = filename. Return data[0] = fd (*), data[1] = res.

name: C_READ
description: data[0] = fd, data[1..2] = read size. Return data[0] = res, data[1..] = data.

name: C_WRITE
description: data[0] = fd, data[1..] = data. Return data[0] = res.

name: C_CLOSE
description: data[0] = fd. Return data[0] = res.

name: C_SEEK
description: data[0] = fd, data[1..5] = offset. Return data[0] = res.

name: C_READDIR
description: No args. Return data[0] = dir entry (formatted). Loop until response size == 2.

name: C_EOF
description: data[0] = fd. Return data[0] == 0 (not eof). Only valid for read fd.

name: C_CD
description: data[0...] = "directory name". Return data[0] = res.

name: C_FREE
description:
Freespace sd card / DSK image.  Return data[0] = "
%iK free

".

name: C_FTELL
description: Implemented v1.0.5. data[0] = fd. Return data[0-3] = current file pos

name: C_READSECTOR
description: For diskimages only. data[0] = track, data[1] = sector, data[2] = drive (not used). Return data[0] = res. data[1..513] sector data

name: C_WRITESECTOR
description: For diskimages only. data[0] = track, data[1] = sector, data[2] = drive (not used) data[3..515] sector data

name: C_FORMATTRACK
description: Not implemented yet

name: C_ERASEFILE
description: data[0] = "filename". Return data[0] = res;

name: C_RENAME
description: data[0] = "newname\0oldname": Return data[0] = res, data[1..] "ascii error".

name: C_MAKEDIR
description: data[0] = "dirname". Return data[0] = res;

name: C_FSIZE
description: Implemented v1.0.5. data[0] = fd. Return data[0-3] = file size

name: C_READ2
description: Implemented v1.0.7. Same as C_READ, except without checking (and seeking past) for AMSDOS header.

name: C_GETPATH
description: Implemented v1.0.8. Return data = current path in ascii.

name: C_SDREAD
description: Implemented v1.0.9.	Read RAW sdcard sector. data[0..3] = Physical LBA, data[4] = numsectors (max. 4).

name: C_SDWRITE
description: Implemented v1.0.9. Write RAW sdcard sector. data[0..3] = Physical LBA, data[4] = numsectors (max. 4),

name: C_FSTAT
description: Implemented v1.1.0. File stat. data[0]=file/dir.  Return:

name: C_NMI
description: Implemented v2.0.5. No args. Trigger NMI/Hackmenu

name: C_HTTPGET
description: data[0] = "url:port/file". Return data[0] = "Downloaded...".

name: C_SETNETWORK
description: data[0] = setupstring (see |netset above).

name: C_M4OFF
description: No args. Disable M4 rom and reset.

name: C_NETSTAT
description: No args. Return data[0] = "network status string".

name: C_TIME
description: No args. Return data[0] = "hh:mm:ss yyyy-mm-dd".

name: C_DIRSETARGS
description: data[0] = "folder/match string" (wildcards etc.) Should be used before C_READDIR, if no args, use null string.

name: C_VERSION
description: No args. Return current M4 and ESP version strings.

name: C_UPGRADE
description: No args. Downloads upgrades from internet, if newer version available.

name: C_HTTPGETMEM
description: data[0..1] = size, data[2] = "url:port/file, offset=". Return data[0..1] = downloaded size. (into internal buf, see C_COPYBUF).

name: C_COPYBUF
description: data[0..1] = offset into internal buf (0..3FFF), data[2..3] = size. Returns data[0] = data (dest).

name: C_COPYFILE
description: data[0..] = "srcfile\0destfile\0". Return data[0] = res, data[1..] = ascii error..

name: C_ROMSUPDATE
description: No Args and return. Updates romchanges made to romconfig.bin and romslots.bin without rebooting.

name: C_NETSOCKET
description: Implemented v1.0.9. data[0] = domain, data[1] = type, data[2] = protocol. Return data[0] = socket number or 0xFF (error).

name: C_NETCONNECT
description: Implemented v1.0.9.	data[0] = socket, data[1..4] = ip, data[5-6] = port. Return data[0] = 0 (OK) or ERROR 0xFF.

name: C_NETCLOSE
description: Implemented v1.0.9.	data[0] = socket.

name: C_NETSEND
description: Implemented v1.0.9. data[0] = socket, data[1..2] = size, data[3...] = outgoing data. Return data[0] = 0 OK, 0xFF error.

name: C_NETRECV
description: Implemented v1.0.9.	data[0] = socket, data[1..2] = receive size (don't flood buffer, max. 0x800).

name: C_NETHOSTIP
description: Implemented v1.0.9. data[0..] = hostname string\0. Return data[0] = 1 Lookup in progress. Any other = error. Look in M4rom sockinfo for IP and status

name: C_NETRSSI
description: Implemented v1.0.9. No args. Return RSSI value for connection (31 = fail, rest? = signal strength).

name: C_NETBIND
description: Implemented v1.0.9. data[0] = socket, data[1..4] = IP number, data[5..6] = port number. return 0 = ok otherwise error.

name: C_NETLISTEN
description: Implemented v1.0.9. data[0] = socket. Return return 0 = ok otherwise error.

name: C_NETACCEPT
description: Implemented v1.0.9. data[0] = socket. Return return 0 = ok otherwise error. Refer to sockinfo for status.

name: C_GETNETWORK
description: Implemented v1.1.0. No args. Returns the following structure:

name: C_WIFIPOW
description: Implemented ?. WiFi power data[0] = 0 turn OFF power, 1 = turn ON power.

name: C_ROMCP
description: Implemented ?. ROM copy within M4 ROMS (RAM) data[0-1] = dest offset, data[2] = src bank (0 for M4 rom, not used yet), data[3-4] = src offset, data[5] = dest bank (0 for M4 rom, not used yet), data[6-7] = size

name: C_ROMWRITE
description: Implemented ?. Write to ROM (M4 or HACK/NMI rom). data[0-1] = dest offset, data[2-3] = size, data[4] = rom (255 = NMI/HACK ROM, 0 = M4 ROM).

name: C_CONFIG
description: Write to M4 ROM config area. data[0] = offset in config area (0xFF04+offset), using command size(-3).

name: C_ROMLOW
description: Implemented v2.0.7. Map lower rom : data[0] = 0 system lower rom, 1 = lowerrom from romboard if enabled, 2 = lowerrom from HACK menu.

text: Each ROM, apart from the OS starts at &C000 in memory. Now, so that the Amstrad doesn't get confused with all these ROMs it is able to switch each one in and out of the memory map. Effectively, each ROM can be turned on or off by your micro as and when it feels like it. Each ROM is given a unique number, for instance BASIC is 0 and the disc ROM is 7. If the micro wants to use the disc ROM, say to load a program off disc, it switches out (or off) all the ROMs except number 7. The machine code routines in this are then located from &C000 onwards and can quite easily be called. Then, after calling a routine the micro switches the disc ROM out and switches in whatever ROM it was using before the interruption.

When the operating system comes across an RSX command it searches through each of the ROMs for the command. So, when we use the |DISC command it switches in ROM 0 (and all the others out) and looks for the command. If it can't find it, it will look in ROM 1, then ROM 2, ROM 3 and so on until it finds it in ROM 7, the disc ROM.

The first byte is the ROM type - 0 for a foreground ROM such as a language, 1 for a background ROM (containing utilities), and 2 for an extension ROM containing bits that won't fit into a foreground ROM. As ROMs are 16k long it's unlikely that you'll see an extension ROM. [Barely suppressed laughter - DC]

The next three bytes aren't that important. They contain the mark, version and. modification level of the ROM and are for your own use. As you modify and improve your ROM you can increase these numbers so that you can tell which is the most recent version.

Byte four marks the start of a normal RSX command table. The first two bytes - 4 and 5 in the ROM header - point to the list of RSX names and the third byte is the start of the jump table. Unlike ordinary RSXs you don't need to log them in by calling &BCD1 and there's no need to provide a four byte workspace.
DEFB 1 ;ROM type ... background
DEFB 1 ;mark 1
DEFB 1 ;version 1
DEFB 1 ;modification 1

When the operating system comes across an RSX command it searches through each of the ROMs for the command. So, when we use the |DISC command it switches in ROM 0 (and all the others out) and looks for the command. If it can't find it, it will look in ROM 1, then ROM 2, ROM 3 and so on until it finds it in ROM 7, the disc ROM.

Two RSX commands are set up - |DOUBLE, a double height text routine (use |DOUBLE,@a$ where a$ contains the text), and |HELP which prints a list of the commands accepted by this ROM. Not tremendously useful you might think, but that isn't my intention. They are two simple commands that show how to implement RSX commands in ROM. We'll see how these are set up.

Byte four marks the start of a normal RSX command table. The first two bytes - 4 and 5 in the ROM header - point to the list of RSX names and the third byte is the start of the jump table. Unlike ordinary RSXs you don't need to log them in by calling &BCD1 and there's no need to provide a four byte workspace.

The first entry in the jump table is rather special and is only called when the Amstrad is reset or powered up. It should also be given a unique name so that it can't be called as an RSX. This can even be an 'illegal' name such as '|MY ROM' - it's impossible to enter, from the keyboard, an RSX name containing a space.

When writing a ROM-based RSX the difficulty lies in not knowing where your workspace is. Every RSX command in ROM is entered with the IY register pointing to the start of this workspace. You must write your code so that no matter where the workspace is located the routine will work providing the IY register points to it.

Byte four marks the start of a normal RSX command table. The first two bytes - 4 and 5 in the ROM header - point to the list of RSX names and the third byte is the start of the jump table. Unlike ordinary RSXs you don't need to log them in by calling &BCD1 and there's no need to provide a four byte workspace.

When this first entry is called by the operating system the lowest and highest memory locations available are passed in the DE and HL registers. If your utilities require some workspace to temporarily store variables you can grab a chunk of RAM by increasing DE or decreasing HL. All the currently available ROMs take RAM from the top of memory by lowering HL so it's probably best to do likewise. During this call the title string is printed and you'll see the message "Computing with the Amstrad ROM" printed when you reset or switch the micro on.

When writing a ROM-based RSX the difficulty lies in not knowing where your workspace is. Every RSX command in ROM is entered with the IY register pointing to the start of this workspace. You must write your code so that no matter where the workspace is located the routine will work providing the IY register points to it.
;Reserves 32 bytes for workspace:
LD (IY+17),A ;workspace+17=length
POP DE       ;DE=workspace
LD B,8       ;copy data to workspace

name: RESET
comment: (RST0/RESET)

name: KL_LO_JUMP
comment: (RST1)

name: KL_JP_BC
comment: in: BC=addr

name: KL_SIDE_CALL_SP
comment: (RST2)

name: KL_JP_DE
comment: in: DE=addr

name: KL_FAR_CALL_SP
comment: (RST3)

name: KL_JP_HL
comment: in: HL=addr

name: KL_RAM_LD_A_HL
comment: (RST4)    ;in: HL=src, out: A=[HL]

name: KL_FIRM_JUMP
comment: (RST5)

name: FREE_FOR_USER
comment: (RST6)

name: INTERRUPT
comment: (RST7/IRQ)

name: GARBAGE_NMI_HANDLER
comment: (THERE'S NO NMI HANDLER IN ROM)

name: KL_U_ROM_ENABLE
comment: out: A=previous_rom_state | Maps upper ROM (&C000-&FFFF).

name: KL_U_ROM_DISABLE
comment: out: A=previous_rom_state | Unmaps upper ROM, mapping screen RAM (&C000-&FFFF).

name: KL_L_ROM_ENABLE
comment: out: A=previous_rom_state | Maps lower ROM (&0000-&3FFF).

name: KL_L_ROM_DISABLE
comment: out: A=previous_rom_state | Unmaps lower ROM, mapping main RAM (&0000-&3FFF).

name: KL_ROM_RESTORE
comment: in: A=rom_state_from_enable_disable | Restores previous ROM/RAM banking state.

name: KL_ROM_SELECT
comment: in: C=rom_number | out: B=prev_state, C=prev_rom. Selects and enables an upper ROM.

name: KL_CURR_SELECTION
comment: out: A=current_rom_number | Gets the currently selected upper ROM number.

name: KL_PROBE_ROM
comment: in: C=rom_number | out: A=class, H=version, L=mark. Gets info for a specified ROM.

name: KL_ROM_DESELECT
comment: in: B=prev_state, C=prev_rom | Reverses KL_ROM_SELECT, restoring previous ROM.

name: KL_RAM_LDIR
comment: in: HL=src, DE=dest, BC=len | Disables ROMs and performs a RAM-to-RAM LDIR.

name: KL_RAM_LDDR
comment: in: HL=src_end, DE=dest_end, BC=len | Disables ROMs and performs a RAM-to-RAM LDDR.

name: KL_POLL_SYNCHRONOUS
comment: out: CARRY=true if no event, CARRY=false if higher priority event exists.

name: KM_WAIT_CHAR
comment: out: A=char (waits until valid char)

name: KM_READ_CHAR
comment: out: A=char, cy=1=valid char

name: KM_CHAR_RETURN
comment: in: A=char (writeback max one char to keybuf)

name: KM_SET_EXPAND
comment: in: B=code, HL=ptr to new string, C=length

name: KM_GET_EXPAND
comment: in: A=code (0-1F,80-9F), L=index, out:A=char, cy,zf

name: KM_EXP_BUF_RESET
comment: in: de=begin, hl=length of buffer, out: cy: 1=okay

name: KM_WAIT_KEY
comment: out: A=char (waits until key pressed)

name: KM_READ_KEY
comment: out: cy:0=none, cy:1=key pressed, A=char

name: KM_TEST_KEY
comment: in: A=keyno, out: nz=pressed, C=ctrl/shift flags

name: KM_GET_LOCKS
comment: out: H=caps lock (caps), L=shift lock (ctrl+caps)

name: KM_GET_JOYSTICK
comment: out: H=joystick 0, L=joystick 1

name: KM_SET_TRANSLATE
comment: in: A=keyno, B=char (normal)

name: KM_GET_TRANSLATE
comment: in: A=keyno, out: A=char (normal)

name: KM_SET_SHIFT
comment: in: A=keyno, B=char (with shift)

name: KM_GET_SHIFT
comment: in: A=keyno, out: A=char (with shift)

name: KM_SET_CTRL
comment: in: A=keyno, B=char (with control)

name: KM_GET_CTRL
comment: in: A=keyno, out: A=char (with control)

name: KM_SET_REPEAT
comment: in: A=keyno, B=repeat flag (FFh=on)

name: KM_GET_REPEAT
comment: in: A=keyno, out: nz=repeat

name: KM_SET_DELAY
comment: in: H=1st delay, L=repeat delay

name: KM_GET_DELAY
comment: out: H=1st delay, L=repeat delay

name: KM_ARM_BREAK
comment: in: de=procedure, c=ROM config

name: TXT_INITIALISE
comment: Resets text VDU to power-on state (Stream 0, PEN 1/PAPER 0, cursor top-left).

name: TXT_RESET
comment: Resets text VDU indirections and the control code table.

name: TXT_VDU_ENABLE
comment: Enables character output to the current stream.

name: TXT_VDU_DISABLE
comment: Disables character output to the current stream.

name: TXT_OUTPUT
comment: in: A=char | Outputs a character or control code to the current stream.

name: TXT_WR_CHAR
comment: in: A=char | Writes a character literally, printing control codes instead of obeying them.

name: TXT_RD_CHAR
comment: out: A=char, CARRY=true if OK. Reads character from screen at current cursor position.

name: TXT_SET_GRAPHIC
comment: in: A=0 for off, non-zero for on | Toggles graphic character printing mode.

name: TXT_WIN_ENABLE
comment: in: H/D=left/right cols, L/E=top/bottom rows | Sets text window boundaries.

name: TXT_GET_WINDOW
comment: out: H/D=left/right, L/E=top/bottom | Gets current text window boundaries.

name: TXT_CLEAR_WINDOW
comment: Clears the current text window and homes the cursor.

name: TXT_SET_COLUMN
comment: in: A=logical_column | Moves cursor to a specific column in the current window.

name: TXT_SET_ROW
comment: in: A=logical_row | Moves cursor to a specific row in the current window.

name: TXT_SET_CURSOR
comment: in: H=logical_column, L=logical_row | Moves cursor to a specific location.

name: TXT_GET_CURSOR
comment: out: H=logical_column, L=logical_row, A=roll_count | Gets current cursor position.

name: TXT_CUR_ENABLE
comment: Enables the text cursor display (user level).

name: TXT_CUR_DISABLE
comment: Disables the text cursor display (user level).

name: TXT_CUR_ON
comment: Enables the text cursor display (OS level).

name: TXT_CUR_OFF
comment: Disables the text cursor display (OS level).

name: TXT_VALIDATE
comment: in: H=col, L=row | out: CARRY=true if no scroll, B=scroll_dir. Checks if cursor pos is in window.

name: TXT_PLACE_CURSOR
comment: Draws the cursor graphic at the current cursor position.

name: TXT_REMOVE_CURSOR
comment: Removes the cursor graphic from the current cursor position.

name: TXT_SET_PEN
comment: in: A=pen_number | Sets the foreground (text) color for the current stream.

name: TXT_GET_PEN
comment: out: A=pen_number | Gets the foreground color for the current stream.

name: TXT_SET_PAPER
comment: in: A=pen_number | Sets the background (paper) color for the current stream.

name: TXT_GET_PAPER
comment: out: A=pen_number | Gets the background color for the current stream.

name: TXT_INVERSE
comment: Swaps the current stream's foreground (pen) and background (paper) colors.

name: TXT_SET_BACK
comment: in: A=0 for opaque, non-zero for transparent | Sets character write mode.

name: TXT_GET_BACK
comment: out: A=0 if opaque, non-zero if transparent | Gets character write mode.

name: TXT_GET_MATRIX
comment: in: A=char | out: HL=matrix_addr, CARRY=true if user-defined. Gets 8-byte font data for a char.

name: TXT_SET_MATRIX
comment: in: A=char, HL=matrix_addr | Defines a user-defined character's 8-byte font data.

name: TXT_SET_M_TABLE
comment: in: DE=first_char, HL=table_addr | Sets the address for a table of user-defined fonts.

name: TXT_GET_M_TABLE
comment: out: A=first_char, HL=table_addr | Gets the address of a user-defined font table.

name: TXT_GET_CONTROLS
comment: out: HL=table_addr | Gets the address of the 32-entry control code routine table.

name: TXT_STR_SELECT
comment: in: A=stream_num | out: A=previous_stream | Selects a new active text stream (0-7).

name: TXT_SWAP_STREAMS
comment: in: B=stream1, C=stream2 | Swaps all attributes (window, colors, cursor) between two streams.

name: GRA_RESET_HOOKS
comment: out: [BDDC+00h..0Ah]=Default jump opcodes/addresses

name: GRA_MOVE_ABSOLUTE
comment: in: de=x, hl=y  ;\set current coordinate

name: GRA_MOVE_RELATIVE
comment: in: de=x, hl=y  ;/

name: GRA_ASK_CURSOR
comment: out: de=x, hl=y ;-get current coordinate

name: GRA_SET_ORIGIN
comment: in: de=x, hl=y (also does MOVE 0,0)

name: GRA_GET_ORIGIN
comment: out: de=x, hl=y

name: GRA_SET_WIN_WIDTH
comment: in: de=x1/left, hl=x2/right

name: GRA_SET_WIN_HEIGHT
comment: in: de=y1/top, hl=y2/bottom

name: GRA_GET_WIN_WIDTH
comment: out: de=x1/left, hl=x2/right

name: GRA_GET_WIN_HEIGHT
comment: out: de=y1/top, hl=y2/bottom

name: GRA_CLEAR_WINDOW
comment: fill window by PAPER (also does MOVE 0,0)

name: GRA_SET_PEN
comment: in: A=color (0..15) for PLOT/LINE/WR_CHAR

name: GRA_GET_PEN
comment: out: A=color (0..15)

name: GRA_SET_PAPER
comment: in: A=color (0..15) for CLEAR_WINDOW/WR_CHAR

name: GRA_GET_PAPER
comment: out: A=color (0..15

name: GRA_PLOT_ABSOLUTE
comment: in: de=x, hl=y  ;\draw pixel at specified coordinate

name: GRA_PLOT_RELATIVE
comment: in: de=x, hl=y  ;/

name: GRA_TEST_ABSOLUTE
comment: in: de=x, hl=y, out: A=color (0..15) of pixel

name: GRA_TEST_RELATIVE
comment: in: de=x, hl=y, out: A=color (0..15) of pixel

name: GRA_LINE_ABSOLUTE
comment: in: de=x, hl=y  ;\draw line from current coordinate

name: GRA_LINE_RELATIVE
comment: in: de=x, hl=y  ;/to specified target coordinate

name: GRA_WR_CHAR
comment: in: A=char      ;-draw char at current coordinate

name: SCR_INITIALISE
comment: Resets Screen Pack to power-on state (Mode 1, screen at &C000, cleared).

name: SCR_RESET
comment: Resets screen indirections, inks, and flashing speeds to defaults.

name: SCR_SET_OFFSET
comment: in: HL=even_offset | Sets the screen's hardware scroll offset.

name: SCR_SET_BASE
comment: in: A=high_byte_of_addr (&C0 or &40) | Sets the screen memory start address.

name: SCR_GET_LOCATION
comment: out: A=high_byte_of_addr, HL=offset | Gets screen memory address and offset.

name: SCR_SET_MODE
comment: in: A=mode (0,1,2) | Sets the screen mode, clears screen, resets windows.

name: SCR_GET_MODE
comment: out: A=mode, C/Z flags also indicate mode. Gets the current screen mode.

name: SCR_CLEAR
comment: Clears the entire screen to the current PEN 0 color.

name: SCR_CHAR_LIMITS
comment: out: B=width_in_chars, C=height_in_chars | Gets screen dimensions in characters.

name: SCR_CHAR_POSITION
comment: in: H=col, L=row | out: HL=addr, B=char_width_bytes. Converts char coords to memory address.

name: SCR_DOT_POSITION
comment: in: DE=x, HL=y | out: HL=addr, C=bit_mask, B=pixels_per_byte-1. Converts pixel coords to address/mask.

name: SCR_NEXT_BYTE
comment: in: HL=addr | out: HL=addr_of_byte_to_right | Calculates address of next screen byte.

name: SCR_PREV_BYTE
comment: in: HL=addr | out: HL=addr_of_byte_to_left | Calculates address of previous screen byte.

name: SCR_NEXT_LINE
comment: in: HL=addr | out: HL=addr_one_line_down | Calculates address of byte below.

name: SCR_PREV_LINE
comment: in: HL=addr | out: HL=addr_one_line_up | Calculates address of byte above.

name: SCR_INK_ENCODE
comment: in: A=pen_number | out: A=encoded_mask | Converts a pen number to a fill mask for the current mode.

name: SCR_INK_DECODE
comment: in: A=encoded_mask | out: A=pen_number | Converts a fill mask back to a pen number.

name: SCR_SET_INK
comment: in: A=pen, B=color1, C=color2 | Sets a pen's color(s). Flashes if B!=C.

name: SCR_GET_INK
comment: in: A=pen | out: B=color1, C=color2 | Gets a pen's color(s).

name: SCR_SET_BORDER
comment: in: B=color1, C=color2 | Sets the border color(s). Flashes if B!=C.

name: SCR_GET_BORDER
comment: out: B=color1, C=color2 | Gets the border color(s).

name: SCR_SET_FLASHING
comment: in: H=time1, L=time2 (in 1/50s) | Sets the speed for flashing colors.

name: SCR_GET_FLASHING
comment: out: H=time1, L=time2 | Gets the speed for flashing colors.

name: SCR_FILL_BOX
comment: in: A=ink_mask, H/D=left/right, L/E=top/bottom | Fills a character-aligned box.

name: SCR_FLOOD_BOX
comment: in: C=encoded_pen, HL=addr, D=width_bytes, E=height_lines | Fills a byte-aligned box.

name: SCR_CHAR_INVERT
comment: in: B/C=encoded_pens, H/L=char_coords | Swaps two PEN colors within a character cell.

name: SCR_HW_ROLL
comment: in: B=direction (0=down, nz=up), A=encoded_paper | Scrolls entire screen by 8 pixels.

name: SCR_SW_ROLL
comment: in: B=dir, A=paper, H/D/L/E=box_coords | Scrolls a character-aligned region of the screen.

name: SCR_UNPACK
comment: in: HL=matrix_addr, DE=dest_addr | Converts 8-byte font matrix to mode-specific pixel masks.

name: SCR_REPACK
comment: in: A=encoded_pen, H/L=coords, DE=dest | Reads screen pixels to build an 8-byte font matrix.

name: SCR_ACCESS
comment: in: A=mode (0=fill, 1=XOR, 2=AND, 3=OR) | Sets the graphics drawing mode.

name: SCR_PIXELS
comment: in: B=pen_mask, C=pixel_mask, HL=addr | Plots pixels directly, ignoring SCR_ACCESS mode.

name: SCR_HORIZONTAL
comment: in: A=encoded_pen, DE=x1, BC=x2, HL=y | Draws a horizontal line.

name: SCR_VERTICAL
comment: in: A=encoded_pen, DE=x, HL=y1, BC=y2 | Draws a vertical line.

name: CAS_SET_SPEED
comment: in: HL=upper16bit, A=lower8bit

name: CAS_NOISY
comment: in: A=output cassette messages (0=yes, >0=no)

name: CAS_START_MOTOR
comment: out: A.bit4 old motor status (0=off, 1=on), cy=0, z=1

name: CAS_STOP_MOTOR
comment: out: A.bit4 old motor status (0=off, 1=on), cy=0, z=1

name: CAS_RESTORE_MOTOR
comment: in: A.bit4 new motor status (0=off, 1=on), cy=0, z=1

name: CAS_IN_OPEN
comment: in: HL=fname, B=fnamelen, DE=workbuf,

name: CAS_IN_CLOSE
comment: out: DE=workbuf, cy=0=failed (no open file)

name: CAS_IN_ABANDON
comment: out: DE=workbuf, cy=1, z=0, A=all_closed (FFh=yes)

name: CAS_IN_CHAR
comment: out: A=char, cy=0=error, zf=errtype

name: CAS_IN_DIRECT
comment: in: HL=dest, out: HL=entrypoint, cy=0=err, zf=errtype

name: CAS_RETURN
comment: in: A=char (undo CAS_IN_CHAR, char back to buffer)

name: CAS_TEST_EOF
comment: out: CY=0=eof (end of file)

name: CAS_OUT_OPEN
comment: in: HL=fname, B=fnamelen, DE=workbuf, out: HL,cy,zf

name: CAS_OUT_CLOSE
comment: out: DE=workbuf, cy=0=failed (zf=errtype)

name: CAS_OUT_ABANDON
comment: out: DE=workbuf, cy=1, z=0, A=all_closed (FFh=yes)

name: CAS_OUT_CHAR
comment: in: A=char, out: cy=0=error, zf=errtype

name: CAS_OUT_DIRECT
comment: in: HL=src, DE=len, BC=entrypoint, A=type, out: cy/zf

name: CAS_CATALOG
comment: in: DE=workbuf, out: DE=workbuf, cy=0=error

name: CAS_WRITE
comment: in: HL=src, DE=len, A=ID(2Ch=header, 16h=data), out?

name: CAS_READ
comment: in: HL=dest, DE=len, A=ID(2Ch=header, 16h=data), out?

name: CAS_CHECK
comment: in: HL=src, DE=len, A=ID(2Ch=header, 16h=data), out?

name: SOUND_QUEUE
comment: in: HL=dat ;ch,env,ent,freq(lo,hi,noise),vol,len(lo,hi)

name: SOUND_CHECK
comment: in: A=channel mask, out: A=channel status

name: SOUND_RELEASE
comment: in: A=channel mask

name: SOUND_SET_ENV
comment: in: A=number (1..15), HL=data (must be >3FFFh)

name: SOUND_SET_ENT
comment: in: A=number (1..15), HL=data (must be >3FFFh)

name: SOUND_GET_ENV
comment: in: A=number (1..15), out: HL=data

name: SOUND_GET_ENT
comment: in: A=number (1..15), out: HL=data

name: KL_CHOKE_OFF
comment: Clears all event/timer queues (except KBD/SOUND).

name: KL_ROM_WALK
comment: in: DE=first_mem, HL=last_mem | Finds, reserves memory for, and initialises all background ROMs.

name: KL_INIT_BACK
comment: in: C=rom_num, DE=first_mem, HL=last_mem | Initialises a specific background ROM.

name: KL_LOG_EXT
comment: in: BC=rsx_table_addr, HL=firmware_data_addr | Logs a new RSX command table with firmware.

name: KL_FIND_COMMAND
comment: in: HL=command_name_addr | out: CARRY=true if found, C=rom_num, HL=routine_addr. Searches for a command.

name: KL_NEW_FRAME_FLY
comment: in: HL=event_block_addr, B=class, C=rom_num, DE=routine_addr | Sets up a new V-Blank event.

name: KL_ADD_FRAME_FLY
comment: in: HL=event_block_addr | Re-adds a deleted V-Blank event to the active list.

name: KL_DEL_FRAME_FLY
comment: in: HL=event_block_addr | Removes a V-Blank event from the active list.

name: KL_NEW_FAST_TICKER
comment: in: HL=event_block_addr, B=class, C=rom_num, DE=routine_addr | Sets up a 1/300th second timer event.

name: KL_ADD_FAST_TICKER
comment: in: HL=event_block_addr | Re-adds a deleted 1/300th sec timer event.

name: KL_DEL_FAST_TICKER
comment: in: HL=event_block_addr | Removes a 1/300th sec timer event.

name: KL_ADD_TICKER
comment: in: HL=event_block_addr, DE=initial_count, BC=reload_count | Sets up a recurring 1/50th sec timer event.

name: KL_DEL_TICKER
comment: in: HL=event_block_addr | out: CARRY=true if found, DE=counter_remaining. Removes a 1/50th sec timer event.

name: KL_INIT_EVENT
comment: in: HL=block_addr, B=class, C=rom_num, DE=routine_addr | Initialises an event block structure.

name: KL_EVENT
comment: in: HL=event_block_addr | Kicks (runs) a specified event block.

name: KL_SYNC_RESET
comment: Clears the entire synchronous event queue (discards waiting events).

name: KL_DEL_SYNCHRONOUS
comment: in: HL=event_block_addr | Removes a synchronous event from the queue.

name: KL_NEXT_SYNC
comment: out: CARRY=true if event found, HL=event_block_addr, A=prev_priority. Finds next highest priority event.

name: KL_DO_SYNC
comment: in: HL=event_block_addr | Runs the event routine.

name: KL_DONE_SYNC
comment: in: A=prev_priority, HL=event_block_addr | Decrements event counter and re-queues if not zero.

name: KL_EVENT_DISABLE
comment: Disables normal synchronous events.

name: KL_EVENT_ENABLE
comment: Enables normal synchronous events.

name: KL_DISARM_EVENT
comment: in: HL=event_block_addr | Disarms (stops) a specific asynchronous event.

name: KL_TIME_PLEASE
comment: out: DEHL=4-byte time_count | Returns time elapsed since power-on (in 1/300ths sec).

name: KL_TIME_SET
comment: in: DEHL=4-byte time_count | Sets the current system elapsed time.

name: MC_BOOT_PROGRAM
comment: in: HL=load_routine_addr | Jumps to loaded program, does not return.

name: MC_START_PROGRAM
comment: in: HL=entry_point, C=ROM_selection | Jumps to foreground program, does not return.

name: MC_WAIT_FLYBACK
comment: Pauses execution until a screen frame flyback occurs. Preserves all registers.

name: MC_SET_MODE
comment: in: A=screen_mode | Sets the hardware screen mode directly.

name: MC_SCREEN_OFFSET
comment: in: A=screen_base, HL=screen_offset | Sets hardware screen memory start address.

name: MC_CLEAR_INKS
comment: in: DE=ink_vector_addr | Sets all pens and border to a single color.

name: MC_SET_INKS
comment: in: DE=ink_vector_addr | Sets all 16 pens and border colors individually.

name: MC_RESET_PRINTER
comment: Resets the MC_WAIT_PRINTER indirection to its default firmware routine.

name: MC_PRINT_CHAR
comment: in: A=char | out: CARRY=true if OK, CARRY=false if busy. Sends char to printer with timeout.

name: MC_BUSY_PRINTER
comment: out: CARRY=true if busy, CARRY=false if not. Tests printer status.

name: MC_SEND_PRINTER
comment: in: A=char | Sends a character to the printer, assuming it is not busy.

name: MC_SOUND_REGISTER
comment: in: A=register_num, C=data | Sends data to a specific sound chip register.

name: JUMP_RESTORE
comment: Restores the main firmware jumpblock to its default state.

name: EDIT_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: io: HL=input buffer, out: CY=0=ESC (also Z=1=ESC)

name: FLO_COPY_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: [HL]=[DE], A=exponent

name: FLO_INT_TO_REAL_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: DE=dest, HL=unsigned16bit, A.7=sign

name: FLO_4BYTE_TO_REAL_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)

name: FLO_REAL_TO_INT_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)

name: FLO_ROUND_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)

name: FLO_FIX_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)

name: FLO_INT_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)

name: FLO_PREP_DECIMAL_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)

name: FLO_MUL_10_A_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)

name: FLO_ADD_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: [HL]=[HL]+[DE]

name: FLO_SUB2_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: [HL]=[DE]-[HL] (swapped operands)

name: FLO_MUL_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: [HL]=[HL]*[DE]

name: FLO_DIV_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: [HL]=[HL]/[DE]

name: FLO_COMPARE_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: [HL]-[DE]

name: FLO_NEG_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)

name: FLO_SGN_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)

name: FLO_DEG_RAD_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: in: A=00h=RAD, FFh=DEG

name: FLO_PI_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: [HL]=PI

name: FLO_SQRT_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)

name: FLO_POT_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: [HL]=[HL]^[DE]

name: FLO_LOG_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: [HL]=LOG([HL])

name: FLO_LOG10_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: [HL]=LOG10([HL])

name: FLO_EXP_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: [HL]=EXP([HL])

name: FLO_SIN_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: [HL]=SIN([HL])

name: FLO_COS_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: [HL]=COS([HL])

name: FLO_TAN_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: [HL]=TAN([HL])

name: FLO_ATN_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: [HL]=ATN([HL])

name: FLO_5BYTE_TO_REAL_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)

name: FLO_RND_INIT_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: seed=89656C07h

name: FLO_RND_SEED_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)
comment: seed=89656C07h xor [HL]

name: FLO_RND_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)

name: FLO_RND_LAST_VAL_6128
section: Edit and Floating Point Functions (Version Specific)

name: HOOK_TXT_DRAW_CURSOR
comment: Draws the cursor graphic at the current text position.

name: HOOK_TXT_UNDRAW_CURSOR
comment: Removes the cursor graphic from the current text position.

name: HOOK_TXT_WRITE_CHAR
comment: in: A=char, H=col, L=row | Writes a single character to an absolute physical screen position.

name: HOOK_TXT_UNWRITE
comment: in: H=col, L=row | out: A=char, CARRY=true if found. Reads a char from an absolute physical position.

name: HOOK_TXT_OUT_ACTION
comment: in: A=char_or_code | The core text output routine; obeys control codes, calls TXT_WRITE_CHAR.

name: HOOK_GRA_PLOT
comment: in: DE=x, HL=y | Plots a single pixel at the given user graphics coordinates.

name: HOOK_GRA_TEST
comment: in: DE=x, HL=y | out: A=pen_number | Returns the pen number of the pixel at the given coordinates.

name: HOOK_GRA_LINE
comment: in: DE=x_end, HL=y_end | Draws a line from the current graphics cursor to the specified endpoint.

name: HOOK_SCR_READ
comment: in: HL=addr, C=pixel_mask | out: A=pen_number | Reads a single pixel from a direct memory address.

name: HOOK_SCR_WRITE
comment: in: HL=addr, C=pixel_mask, B=encoded_pen | Writes pixel(s) to a direct memory address.

name: HOOK_SCR_MODE_CLEAR
comment: Fills the entire 16K screen memory with &00 bytes (clears to PEN 0).

name: HOOK_KM_TEST_BREAK
comment: in: C=shift_state, interrupts disabled | Checks if the ESC key has been pressed.

name: HOOK_MC_WAIT_PRINTER
comment: in: A=char | out: CARRY=true if OK, CARRY=false if busy. Sends char to printer with timeout.

name: HOOK_KM_SCAN_KEYS
comment: Scans the entire keyboard matrix and updates internal key state table.

name: ROM header byte 0: ROM type
summary: ROM type byte at offset 0 determines foreground/background/extension.

name: ROM header byte 1: mark
summary: ROM identification mark byte (used by firmware probe).

name: ROM header byte 2: version
summary: ROM version byte (used by firmware probe).

name: ROM header word at bytes 4-5: RSX command table pointer
summary: Pointer (within ROM address space, usually &C000-based) to the RSX name table / command table.
heuristics: If non-zero, should point inside this 16K ROM mapping (&C000..&FFFF) for an upper ROM.
If pointer looks outside ROM, treat header as non-standard and fall back to raw bytes.

name: ROM header jump table starting at byte 6
entry_format: JP nn (opcode C3 + addr lo + addr hi)
summary: Jump table entries (JP) for ROM routines; first entry is typically init entrypoint used on reset/power-up depending on ROM type.
heuristics: Consecutive bytes often begin with 0xC3 for each JP entry.
Stop when JP pattern breaks or when reaching RSX table pointer region.

name: ROM init routine entry semantics
summary: When firmware calls a ROM init, registers may carry memory bounds; ROM may reserve workspace by adjusting HL/DE (exact convention depends on ROM type/background/foreground). Treat as calling convention hint, not ground truth.

name: RSX name table format
summary: RSX names are uppercase; final character of a name has bit 7 set to mark end-of-name. Names are typically stored sequentially.
heuristics: Scan from RSX table pointer: collect bytes until you see a byte with bit7=1; clear bit7 to get final character.
Expect printable ASCII A-Z, 0-9, and a few symbols; if not, lower confidence.

name: RSX dispatch table structure
summary: After RSX names, a table of handler addresses (or pointers to routines) follows in the same order as names. Exact layout varies; common pattern is 16-bit little-endian addresses per command.
heuristics: Number of handler pointers should equal number of RSX names parsed.
Each handler address should plausibly land within ROM (&C000..&FFFF) or be a firmware entry (e.g., &Bxxx) for trampolines.

name: RSX name table range
summary: RSX name table starts at the header pointer (bytes 4-5) and continues until a 0 byte terminator. Names use 7-bit ASCII with bit7 set on the last character.
heuristics: Start at pointer; collect bytes until 0x00 terminator.
Last character of each name has bit7 set; clear bit7 for display.

name: RSX name table terminator
summary: RSX name table is terminated by a 0 byte.
heuristics: Stop parsing name table when byte value is 0x00.

summary: String table near ROM end uses ASCII with high-bit set on final character and embedded marker bytes.
Likely 8x8 font/bitmap glyph block (0x180 bytes) near ROM end.

Data block includes plain ASCII filenames and wildcard masks (PHONE.DIR, TEMPS.TEM, TAGS.TAG, CONFIG.CONF, MDTGC*.CAR*.MES*.DIR*.TEM*.TAG*.CON). Nearby is a 0x05-prefixed table of 16-bit addresses in the F7xx/F8xx range (e.g. F896, F8AA, F52E, F7A8, F8A0, F8B4, F8BE).
